Actual behavior: Icons of the extensions don't show up

data.title: Support links that point outside of the workspace (output pane)

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body: Text inside the output pane is only recognized as a link if it points to somewhere within the VSCode workspace. I have an extension that writes files to a temporary path and would like links to these to be clickable in the output pane.

data.title: Release notes reloaded when switching between tabs
data.body: When reviewing the release notes of the latest version of VSC, if you scroll down to a section or click on a link to take you to a place in the release notes, then tap on a tab containing your source code and then switch back to the release notes, the release notes reload and you lose the position you were last at. Don't reload the release notes when switching between tabs.

data.title: Cannot debug Hello World NET Core application - dependent assemblies not found
Greater than 1000+ multi cursor typing replacement text appears inverted, lines begin to drop off selection.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version:  Windows 10 14393.447

Greater than 1000 multi cursor typing replacement text appears inverted, lines begin to drop off selection.

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Open a large file (https://raw.githubusercontent.com/charliesome/australia_postcode/master/lib/australia/postcode/data.csv)
2. Multi cursor select on newline
3. Begin typing replacement text.
4. Notice characters appear to type in reverse, and some of the selected lines are dropping off.

Example: ![Example](https://media.giphy.com/media/xUPGcEVPEiaHZNYTjW/giphy.gif)

Mayby related to #7201

data.title: Search tree: adopt templated rendering
data.body: Today the search tree is using [`ActionsRenderer`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/search/browser/searchResultsView.ts#L129) which is basically a `LegacyRenderer` that has to create all DOM elements for each item. Much better to directly extend `IRenderer` and adopt the templated approach to rendering (see [`CallStackRenderer`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/parts/debug/electron-browser/debugViewer.ts#L413) for example).

Couldn't detect the repository where this extension is published. Images might be broken in its README.

I can't find any info on their documentation to fix this.

data.title: Git Diff not showing the diff
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version:Version 1.11.0-insider (1.11.0-insider) ce0277bf8e30329fddcba1b67f8ba7314c10c97e
- OS Version: 10.10

Steps to Reproduce:
Click the SCM icon, view list of changed files. Pick one. Then wait forever while watching the blue line move across the top over and over again. Never see the actual diff. This behavior began about a week ago. 

This is from the output screen:
Using git 2.5.4 (Apple Git-61) from /usr/bin/git
git rev-parse --show-toplevel
git rev-parse --show-toplevel
git config --get commit.template
git status -z -u
git fetch

git symbolic-ref --short HEAD
git rev-parse master
git rev-parse --symbolic-full-name --abbrev-ref master@{u}
git rev-list --left-right master...gitlab/master
git for-each-ref --format %(refname) %(objectname)
git remote --verbose

data.title: Explorer gets messed up when creating a new folder and scroll without typing anything
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T14:02:52.799Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|auto-close-tag|formulahendry|0.3.10|
|rest-client|humao|0.14.0|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.1|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.11.0|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.7.2|
|material-icon-theme|PKief|2.0.3|
|sass-indented|robinbentley|1.3.1|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

This seems to only happen when you have a lot of files and folders you can scroll.
1. Right click to create a new folder somewhere a couple levels deep towards the bottom of your directory explorer. When a box appears to type a name, without typing anything, scroll up until the input box scrolls off the screen.
2. Scroll back down to where your box is/was. Now the folder you were going to create has disappeared along with the parent folder and all the children of the directory have shifted up.

data.title: Feature: Filter by completion kind in intellisense
data.body:
Visual Studio 2017 has a panel down at the bottom of the completion popup where user can select of which type only to show items. This helps when we know we're looking for a property.

These tabs are also controllable by keyboard shortcuts.

![completion kind filter](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1889343/24678685/d8dea204-198b-11e7-9127-373a987425a6.PNG)

It would be nice to have this in vs code as well :-)

data.title: Option to keep file selected in sidebar without forcing a scroll
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.3

This is closely related to #14745.

## Summary: 
I want the selected file in the sidebar to always be my active tab - but **do not** want the sidebar to scroll just because the file is currently not visible in the sidebar.   

That scrolling is the entire reason I turned off `autoReveal` in the first place.

### Options Not Used + Why:  

1. **autoReveal** - (see #14745) automatically scrolling / causing the user to lose their place in the file tree is extremely annoying.
2. **Open Editors Panel** - When there are two files close together in the hierarchy, with the same name, it's too easy to accidentally misread the file paths (especially when they're very long) for that to be a satisfactory replacement for the traditional hierarchy.
3. **Keyboard Shortcut** - [keyboard shortcuts](http://stackoverflow.com/a/42493479) are great, but this should be one of those "don't make me think" things - not a key combo that has to be pressed hundreds of times/day.

data.title: Vscode node debugger not stopping on breakpoints when launching with nodemon
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 7 Profesionnal, SP1

Hi everyone.

I'm trying to debug typescript code (or javascript code) in server side with visual studio code, when launching it with nodemon. I've added a new configuration in launch.json which looks like this:

```
{
      "type": "node",
      "request": "launch",
      "name": "Launch server with Nodemon",
      "runtimeExecutable": "nodemon",
      "runtimeArgs": [
        "--debug=5858"
      ],
      "program": "${workspaceRoot}/src/server.ts",
      "restart": true,
      "port": 5858,
      "console": "integratedTerminal",
      "internalConsoleOptions": "neverOpen",
      "outFiles": ["${workspaceRoot}/build/**/*.js"]
    }
```
I have a task in vscode that is running tsc that builds javascript files properly. This is my current task config:
```
{
  // See https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=733558
  // for the documentation about the tasks.json format
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "command": "tsc",
  "isShellCommand": true,
  "args": ["-p", "."],
  "showOutput": "silent",
  "problemMatcher": "$tsc"
}
```
The javascript files are generated as expected when I change a typescript file.
And the nodejs server is restarting as expected when a javascript file is generated. 

But I am not able to break on any breakpoint (on typescript files or javascript files).

Can you tell me please if it is an issue or if there is something I am missing ?

Thank you for your help

data.title: Add missing import use package.json "typings" property
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Add missing import is great feature but it does not work best way. 

Lets say i have module `@ng/common`
in module i have `package.json` in root directory and `index.d.ts` in dist directory.

In package.json i have `"typings": "dist/index.d.ts"`. 

When i want to use this module i want to write `import {Utils} from '@ng/common';` but vscode quick fix import missing import offers me different imports like this `import {Utils} from '@ng/common/dist';` which is not what i want. Is it possible to make it look into package.json for obtaining these information about import? Also when i use `@angular` it is same. Sometimes it even offers me more options. Same things reexported from multiple files, but none exported using package.json. 

Also nice thing would be if it uses shortest "path" export if some type is reexported.

I dont know if this is thing for vscode, or typescript directly.

Thank you for any help :).

data.title: Test Tour: Angular 2
data.body:
see #23385 for the theory.

Angular quick starter: https://github.com/angular/quickstart

Extensions: 
- [Angular language service](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=Angular.ng-template)
- Setup tasks or use [NPM Script Runner](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=eg2.vscode-npm-script) to run the scripts in the package.json

Implement & run some [protractor tests](http://www.protractortest.org/#/).
